required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This will be a retrospective cohort study comparing women obtaining an abortion in New Mexico and living in Texas and women obtaining an abortion in New Mexico and living in New Mexico .

detailed_description.textblock: This will be a retrospective cohort study comparing women obtaining an abortion in New Mexico and living in Texas and women obtaining an abortion in New Mexico and living in New Mexico in two different time periods (time period #1 is from January 1 2012-December 31 2012 and time period #2 is from May 1 2014-April 30 2015. Our exposure is a state in which a woman lives in (New Mexico or Texas). Our intervention is the change in Texan laws occurring from July 2013-January 2014.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women from Texas travelling to NM, to obtain an abortion.
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of this study is to determine whether the proportion of Texan women obtaining an induced abortion in New Mexico increased between time period #1 and time period #2.

arm_group.description: Women who obtained an abortion from January 1 2012-December 31 2012
Women who obtained an abortion from May 1 2014-April 30 2015.

intervention.description: The change in Texan laws occurring from July 2013-January 2014

study_pop.textblock: Charts of women obtaining an induced abortion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women obtaining an induced abortion at one of the following clinics:
University of New Mexico's Center for Reproductive Health (UNM CRH), Planned Parenthood - Albuquerque Surgical Center or Southwestern Women's Options.
- Women residing in Texas or New Mexico. -Women obtaining an induced abortion between January 1 2012-
Exclusion Criteria:
- No chart available for data extraction
- Gestational age at time of abortion initiation â‰¥ 24 weeks gestation as determined by ultrasound imaging.
